name: detraction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a fact or situation that makes something seem less valuable, less useful, less attractive, etc. : detraction from But those are minor detractions from an otherwise excellent programme. Despite the cost savings, coal also has a number of detractions. He defended the idea from any detraction.
criticism that harms someone's reputation: He gave no answer to the malicious detractions of his enemies. There was a lot of denial and detraction from the government.
More examplesFewer examplesHaving said that, such a matter should not be a detraction from this beautiful place. Cost has always been a chief detraction for many people.I do not mean this in any way to be a detraction or a criticism.
